intro: Oxydectes horridula, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats. Its leaves are thick and covered in a fine, waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Oxydectes horridula is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
